events.message: The applicant has submitted their personal loan application requesting funds to cover upcoming medical expenses and outstanding debts.
The application was reviewed and categorised under personal loans due to the applicant's explanation of medical and debt-related funding needs.
Loan officer Sarah K. was assigned to manage this personal loan case, beginning initial interactions with the applicant.
An initial review of the applicant's financial documents and credit history was completed to assess eligibility and risk factors.
Additional documents were requested from the applicant, including detailed medical bills, proof of income, and debt statements.
The applicant submitted all requested documents on time, including medical invoices, salary slips, and credit card statements.
Credit check was performed, revealing a moderate credit score with a few late payments but no defaults.
The risk team completed their assessment, determining the applicant has manageable risk with strong repayment potential.
A loan offer of $15,000 with a fixed interest rate and 36-month repayment term was presented to the applicant.
The applicant responded with questions regarding repayment schedules and requested clarification on early payment penalties.
Due to applicant's unique financial situation, the case was escalated for senior management review before final approval.
Senior management approved the loan application, confirming terms and authorising disbursement of requested amount.
The approved funds were transferred to the applicantâ€™s bank account to assist with medical payments and debt clearing.
Follow-up call was conducted with the applicant to ensure satisfaction with the loan process and to offer ongoing support.
The loan case was officially closed after all procedures were completed and the applicant confirmed acceptance of loan terms.
